clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Phenol is primarily indicated for minor sore throat pain sore mouth minor mouth irritation and pain associated with canker sores Additionally phenol is indicated in the treatment of focal spasticity

contraindications.disease: Mouse Subcutaneous LD50 0 3 0 35 g kg Duplay and Cazin 1891 Tollens 1905 Rat Subcutaneous LD50 0 45 Deichmann and Witherup 1944 Rat Oral LD50 0 53 Deichmann and Witherup 1944 Rat Oral LD50 0 65 Flickinger 1976 Rat Cutaneous LD50 0 67 Conning and Hayes 1970

incompatibilities.description: Phenol may decrease effectiveness of Benzylpenicilloyl polylysine as a diagnostic agent
The therapeutic efficacy of Betahistine can be decreased when used in combination with Phenol
The therapeutic efficacy of Hyaluronidase ovine can be decreased when used in combination with Phenol
The therapeutic efficacy of Hyaluronidase human recombinant can be decreased when used in combination with Phenol
The therapeutic efficacy of Hyaluronidase can be decreased when used in combination with Phenol
Amphetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Phenol
Phentermine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Phenol
Pseudoephedrine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Phenol
Benzphetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Phenol
Diethylpropion may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Phenol
Lisdexamfetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Phenol
Mephentermine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Phenol
MMDA may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Phenol
Midomafetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Phenol
2 5 Dimethoxy 4 ethylamphetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Phenol
4 Bromo 2 5 dimethoxyamphetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Phenol
Tenamfetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Phenol
Chlorphentermine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Phenol
Methylenedioxyethamphetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Phenol
Dextroamphetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Phenol
Metamfetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Phenol
Iofetamine I 123 may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Phenol
Ritobegron may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Phenol
Mephedrone may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Phenol
Methoxyphenamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Phenol
Gepefrine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Phenol
2 5 Dimethoxy 4 ethylthioamphetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Phenol
Phenol may decrease effectiveness of Technetium Tc 99m tilmanocept as a diagnostic agent
